page.title: 02FARMING AND LANDSCAPE
page.content: Most of the area that extends north of Luton is used for arable farming. The section that we surveyed contain roughly six farms covering an area of approximately seven square kilometres. In this area there are two or three villages and the farms tend to be situated on the edge of the village. The farm boundaries in the south extend right up to the Luton border and this land is currently under threat as the town grows northwards. During the last ten years a considerable amount of farming land has been built upon and farms such as Little Bramingham Farm have been swallowed up by the growth of the town.This process is likely to continue over the next few years as the town expands further northwards.
